page.title: 11FARMING, HASELOR, WARKS.
page.content: One day I went to Mr.Gray-Cheape to ask him some questions about his farming. Although his house is not in our area for the survey he does own most of the land in Haselor,so his crops are grown in Haselor. He has 220 sheep,his wife has two horses she uses for hunting and keeps them in the barn by their house. He keeps fresian cattle in his barn for feeding up for beef. He grows barley,wheat and beans. The beans are a break crop, he sells some and keeps some for feeding his animals. He employs a gamekeeper(see page 1)to look after the pheasants and partridges in his woods. In the winter he has shooting parties and local men act as his beaters. These walk across the land to make the pheasants and partridge fly towards the shooting party. They have dogs to retrieve the birds.
